Note that this may cause the cache to exceed its limit, resulting in some messages being missed. If you are in a lot of servers, this may significantly increase the chances of messages being logged, which can result in a large message record and the inclusion of irrelevant messages.

fetchingQuests.title: Fetching Quests
fetchingQuests.description: Configure how often to fetch Quests from Discord and set up alerts for new Quests.
fetchingQuests.defaultBehavior: By default, Discord only fetches Quests on load and when visiting the Quests page. This means that without a fetch interval defined below, this plugin will become unaware of new Quests added throughout the day.
fetchingQuests.requirement: This relies on the Quest Button being enabled and set to either {{unclaimed}}, or set to {{always}} with unclaimed {{pill}}, {{badge}}, or {{both}} indicators enabled. Otherwise, there is no reason to periodically fetch Quests.
fetchingQuests.blockWarning: Also, if {{fetchingQuests}} is blocked in the {{questFeatures}} setting, this will not work.
fetchingQuests.intervalPlaceholder: Select or type an interval between 30 minutes and 12 hours.
fetchingQuests.intervalFeedback: Intervals must be between 30 minutes and 12 hours.

searchFix.name: SearchFix
searchFix.description: Fixes the annoying 'We dropped the magnifying glass!' error.
searchFix.notPerfect: This fix isn't perfect, so you may have to reload the search bar to fix issues.
searchFix.paragraph1: Discord only allows a max offset of 5000 (this is what causes the magnifying glass error).
searchFix.paragraph2: This means that you can only see precisely 5000 messages into the past, and 5000 messages into the future (when sorting by old).
searchFix.paragraph3: This plugin just jumps to the opposite sorting method to try get around Discord's restriction,
searchFix.paragraph4: but if there is a large search result, and you try to view a message that is unobtainable with both methods of sorting,
searchFix.paragraph5: the plugin will simply show offset 0 (either newest or oldest message depending on the sorting method).

You can have up to three prefixes and three suffixes per name.

friendNameColor.label: Friend Name Color
friendNameColor.description: The color to use for a friend's nickname if it's not the first displayed. Leave blank for default. Accepts hex(a), rgb(a), or hsl(a) input. Use 'Role' to follow the user's top role color. Use 'Role+-#' to adjust the brightness by that percentage (ex: 'Role+15')

nicknameColor.label: Nickname Color
nicknameColor.description: The color to use for the nickname if it's not the first displayed. Leave blank for default. Accepts hex(a), rgb(a), or hsl(a) input. Use 'Role' to follow the user's top role color. Use 'Role+-#' to adjust the brightness by that percentage (ex: 'Role+15')

displayNameColor.label: Display Name Color
displayNameColor.description: The color to use for the display name if it's not the first displayed. Leave blank for default. Accepts hex(a), rgb(a), or hsl(a) input. Use 'Role' to follow the user's top role color. Use 'Role+-#' to adjust the brightness by that percentage (ex: 'Role+15')

usernameColor.label: Username Color
usernameColor.description: The color to use for the username if it's not the first displayed. Leave blank for default. Accepts hex(a), rgb(a), or hsl(a) input. Use 'Role' to follow the user's top role color. Use 'Role+-#' to adjust the brightness by that percentage (ex: 'Role+15')

triggerNameRerender.label: Trigger Name Rerender
triggerNameRerender.description: Trigger a name rerender by toggling this setting.

uselessInfo.name: UselessInfo
uselessInfo.description: Shows random useless information within Discord; shortcuts and spacing are adjustable.

historyHotkey.label: History Panel Shortcut
historyHotkey.description: Hotkey to show a history of previously shown facts

randomFactHotkey.label: Random Fact Shortcut
randomFactHotkey.description: Hotkey to open the random fact panel

sameFact.label: Avoid showing same items
sameFact.description: Avoid showing the same fact multiple times until all facts have been shown

lastNFacts.label: How many recents to avoid
lastNFacts.description: Number of most recently shown facts to avoid repeating (0 = all-time)

history.none: No facts yet. Use the shortcut or wait.
